node.title: Russian attack on Ukraine possible 'any day now', White House says
node.description: The US says Russia has prepared '70 per cent' of military might toÂ launch an attack on Ukraine, but that a peaceful solution to the tensions is not out of the question.
node.content:
["Russia could invade Ukraine within days or weeks but could still opt for a diplomatic path, according to White House national security adviser Jake Sullivan.", "\"We are in the window. Any day now, Russia could take military action against Ukraine, or it could be a couple of weeks from now, or Russia could choose to take the diplomatic path instead,\" Mr Sullivan said.", "\"If war breaks out, it will come at an enormous human cost to Ukraine, but we believe that based on our preparations and our response, it will come at a strategic cost to Russia as well.\"", "The senior adviser to President Joe Biden offered the stark warning the day after US officials confirmed that Russia had assembled at least 70 per cent of the military firepower it likely intended to have in place by mid-month to give President Vladimir Putin the option of launching a full-scale invasion of Ukraine.", "", "
White House national security adviser Jake Sullivan said Vladimir Putin was in a position to act against Ukraine \"at any time\".(AP: Alex Brandon)
", "Mr Sullivan, making\u00a0appearances on a trio of Sunday talk shows, did not directly address reports that the US government had been briefed that\u00a0a full Russian invasion could lead to the quick capture of Kyiv and potentially result in as many as 50,000 casualties.", "As Russia masses more than 100,000 troops near the border, Moscow has said it is not planning an invasion but could take unspecified military action if its security demands are not met.", "Those include a promise that NATO will never admit Ukraine, a demand the United States and the 30-nation Western security alliance have called unacceptable.", "Possible Russian action could include annexing Ukraine's Donbass region, where Russian-backed separatists broke away from Ukrainian government control in 2014, cyber attacks or a full-scale invasion of Ukraine, Mr Sullivan added.", "", "
Russia is estimated to have\u00a0more than 100,000 troops near the Ukraine border.(AP: Russian Defense Ministry)
", "\"We believe that there is a very distinct possibility that Vladimir Putin will order an attack on Ukraine,\" Mr Sullivan said.", "\"It could take a number of different forms. It could happen as soon as tomorrow, or it could take some weeks yet.", "Washington has made clear it would not send US soldiers to defend Ukraine, which is not a member of NATO.", "However, Washington has given Kyiv arms and last week said it would send nearly 3,000 extra troops to Poland and Romania to shield Eastern Europe from potential spillover from the crisis.", "", "
The US says the troops are being deployed to\u00a0help protect America's NATO allies from any Russian aggression.\u00a0(AP: Ukrainian Defense Ministry Press Service)
", "Over the weekend, a\u00a0plane carrying US troops landed in Poland.", "Those troops are believed to be from\u00a0around 1,700 service members the Pentagon said would deploy from Fort Bragg, North Carolina, to Poland.", "Last week, Mr Biden administration officials revealed\u00a0intelligence findings showing\u00a0the Kremlin had worked up an elaborate plot to fabricate an attack by Ukrainian forces that Russia could use as a pretext to take military action against its neighbour.", "Pentagon spokesman John Kirby said\u00a0the scheme included production of a graphic propaganda video that would show staged explosions and use corpses and actors depicting grieving mourners.", "
Allies threaten Russia with extensive sanctions
", "The US, with its allies, has threatened extensive economic sanctions against Russia. These could include financial sanctions as well as export-control measures.", "US Deputy Treasury Secretary Wally Adeyemo said any sanctions would hit Mr Putin and Russian elites hard given their reliance on Europe, which is Russia's largest trading partner, and the US dollar.", "\"By the United States and Europe acting together, we put ourselves in a position where we not only would have an impact on the overall Russian economy but we'd have a direct impact on President Putin, who is tied to the Russian economy,\" Mr Adeyemo said.", "Each day, Russian financial institutions do about $46 billion ($65 billion) worth of financial transactions globally with 80 per cent of those in US dollars, Mr Adeyemo said.", "Russia's biggest trading partner is Europe, accounting for about 40 per cent of Russian commerce.", "Asked if Russia could instead just turn to China, Mr Adeyemo said the severity of planned US sanctions and Russia's ties with the West would make that difficult.", "\"China can't give Russia what they don't have,\" he said, saying China \"does not have access\" to critical technologies Russia relies on from the United States and its allies, nor is China where Russian elites prefer to put their money.", "\"Russian elites, who would be cut off from the global financial system, are not putting their money in China,\" he said.", "\"They're putting their money in Europe and in the United States.\"", "
Kremlin is top destination for spooked European leaders
", "Rarely in recent years has the Kremlin been so popular with European visitors.", "French President Emmanuel Macron arrives Monday. The Hungarian Prime Minister visited last week. And in days to come, the German Chancellor will be there, too.", "", "
French President Emmanuel Macron arrived in Moscow on Monday, hoping to convince Mr Putin against starting a war with Ukraine.(Reuters: Stephane De Sakutin)
", "All are hoping to get through to Mr Putin, the man who single-handedly shapes Russia's course amid its military build-up near Ukraine.", "\"The priority for me on the Ukrainian question is dialogue with Russia and de-escalation,\" Mr Macron said this week.", "There\u00a0are, however, some signs that relations could thaw.", "\"From Putin's perspective, he already has had something of a win, because he's got our undivided attention and part of the exercise was clearly to get us to focus on him,\" Fiona Hill, a former US intelligence officer on Russia and Eurasian affairs, testified last week during a congressional hearing.", "Mr Macron insists Europeans must have a say in the crisis that threatens the stability of the continent.", "Mr Macron and Mr Putin have already spoken three times by phone in recent days \u2014 with inconclusive results.", "The French President has in the past shown scepticism of NATO, and in 2019 said the organisation was experiencing \"brain death.\"", "On Saturday, that scepticism was nowhere to be found, as Mr Macron spoke by phone with NATO's Secretary-General and underscored \"France's commitment within NATO for the security of its allies\".", "France has also offered to send troops to Romania as part of NATO.", "AP/ Reuters"]
